tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] Deutsche Reichspost Postkarte
An Herrn Dr. H. Schenker in Wien III Wohnung Fraungasse 1.
{verso} [printed header with handwritten date inserted] HERAUSGEBER: [–] BERLIN W. 9. 29.9 93 MAXIMILIAN HARDEN [–] DIE ZUKUNFT [–] 27 KÖTHENER STRASSE. [decorated printed rule]

der Artikel über Leoncavallo| This became “Ruggiero Leoncavallo,” which appeared in Die Zukunft on January 20, 1894. It is reprinted in Hellmut Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker als Essayist und Kritiker (Hildesheim: Olms, 1990), pp. 66-69. wird mir vor den Medici| That is, before the opera opens in Berlin. sehr willkommen sein; vielleicht können wir ihn Gerede in der betr. Woche bringen. Auch Bruckner This became “Anton Bruckner,” which appeared in Die Zukunft on October 21, 1893. It is reprinted in Hellmut Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker als Essayist und Kritiker (Hildesheim: Olms, 1990), pp. 57-61. ist willkommen. Wann wird seine Symphonie gespielt?
Mit bestem Dank, in herzlicher Hochachtung Ihr erg. [signed:]Harden

tei:translation.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] German Imperial Post Postcard
To Dr. H. Schenker in Vienna III Address Fraungasse 1.
{verso} [printed header with handwritten date inserted] EDITOR: [–] BERLIN W. 9. September 29, 93 MAXIMILIAN HARDEN [–] DIE ZUKUNFT [–] 27 KÖTHENER STRASSE. [decorated printed rule]
I would very much welcome the article on Leoncavallo before I Medici; perhaps we can get him talked about during the appropriate week. The Bruckner is welcome too. When will his symphony be played?
With sincere thanks, in cordial esteem, Yours faithfully, [signed:] Harden
